summary: President Trump renewed threats that he may stick to his self-imposed July 9 deadline for making trade deals and issue new tariff levels to trading partners . "No, I'm not thinking about the pause," Trump said aboard Air Force One when asked if he would extend the tariff pause .  Top administration officials have been providing mixed signals on the malleability of the July 9 deadline . The EU has signaled it was willing to accept a 10% universal tariff on many of its exports but is seeking exemptions for pharmaceuticals, alcohol, semiconductors and commercial aircraft .  Canada scrapped its digital services tax on US technology companies, such as Apple and Amazon . The White House said trade talks between the two countries had resumed after Trump threatened to cut off trade talks .  US manufacturing remained weak in June . New orders were low and input costs went up slightly . This shows Trump's tariffs on imports are still making it hard for businesses to plan .  Powell: "All inflation forecasts for the United States went up materially as a consequence of the tariffs" Powell said the US economy remains healthy overall but that he expects to see the effects of tariffs if they filter through the data in the coming months .  The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is up 5% year to date, rebounding from its April slump after Trump's "Liberation Day" tariffs were announced . India is currently on track to seal an interim trade agreement with the US as soon as next week, according to a report in the FT .  President Trump's team has decided to focus on smaller trade deals instead of big, wide-ranging agreements, according to a report . Officials want to reach phased deals with countries that are most ready to talk before July 9 .  President Trump said Monday he was willing to impose a higher tariff rate on Japan, saying the country refused to accept US rice exports . Trump's statement that he would send a letter to Japan outlining the new tariff rate comes a little more than a week before a July 9 deadline . European Union, looking to clinch a trade deal with the US, is prepared to accept a 10% tariff of 10% on goods exported to the US .  President Trump has threatened to send letters to trading partners should negotiations break down . Japan sought exemption from 25% auto tariffs on July 9 if no deal is reached and the tariff pause is not extended .  The European Union is pushing back against the US and its criticism of the bloc's tech rules, which many feared may have been included as part of trade negotiations . South Korea is looking for an extension to the July 9 tariff deadline .  US and China reached a deal to resumerare earth exports in London this month . Both sides are keen to ease tensions before tariffs rise further on August 9, when broader duties could rise 50% . President Trump threatened new tariffs within a week if no deal is reached .  Goldman Sachs said Q2 earnings will show the immediate impact of tariffs . Most costs will be passed on to consumers, but margins will suffer if firms absorb more than expected . US and Mexico negotiating quota deal to reduce steel tariffs .  Canada cancels planned digital services tax on US tech firms . Move aims to revive stalled trade talks with the US, with President Trump calling it a "blatant attack" General Mills stock fell 5% last week due to a weak forecast and tariff warning . Nike rose 15% after announcing it will offset higher duties .  President Trump says he doesn't think he'll need to extend July 9 tariffs deadline . A 90-day pause on the levies slated for imports from China is in effect, but such tariffs would hit the fireworks industry hard . Nearly all fireworks used in the US are generated from Canadians .  President Trump and his team offered a host of options for what to expect in the months ahead . The president reiterated his plan to send letters to dictate tariff rates for at least some countries, perhaps as soon as next week .  President Trump threatens to set a new tariff rate on goods imported from Canada within the next week . The reason is Canada's plan to implement a digital services tax, which could affect US tech companies . Just hours earlier, the US and China cemented the trade truce first agreed to last month .  "Liberation Day" tariffs have been off for a week and a half . But President Donald Trump says he's not sure if tariffs will be back on track . He also teased a potential deal with India, saying it's "going very quickly"  Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Friday that the US could wrap up its most important trade deals by Labor Day . US and EU officials are confident of clinching a trade deal before a July 9 deadline .  Nike could see a $1 billion tariff hit to profits this year! How the consumer responds to the higher prices will determine if the tariff hit is a greater-than-expected weight on the business . Beijing has backed up the plans for trade easing laid out by the US .  President Trump said Thursday that the US and China have "signed" a trade deal . The deal builds on meetings in Geneva between representatives of both nations and implements measures previously agreed upon . Talks had stalled over issues such as US export .  Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick has hinted that deals are incoming with the largest trade partners . The announcement comes a deadline looms for the US to reimpose tariffs of up to 50% on several trading partners by July 9 unless the countries reach permanent agreements .  White House Council of Economic Advisers chairman Stephen Miran spoke with Yahoo Finance'sBrian Sozziearlier today about the state of tariff negotiations two weeks out for the Trump administration's self-imposed July 9 deadline . That deadline marks the end of a tariff pause on higher levels of "Liberation Day" tariffs .  Associated British Foods may become the first casualty of Britain's tariff deal with the US . Toy prices are going up faster than ever, mainly because of new tariffs in an industry where most toys are made in China .  EU competition chief Teresa Ribera said the EU's crackdown on Apple (AAPL), Meta (META), and Alphabet (GOOG,GOOGL) is not a bargaining chip in trade negotiations with President Trump . Ah Biao a toy factory in southern China that makes magnetic and sensory toys for American children, rented a factory to avoid President Trump's tariff blitz .  Japan's chief trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa has reinforced the message that it cannot accept US tariffs of 25% on cars . He said the country's automakers produce far more cars in the US than they export to America . President Donald Trump is publicly criticizing Spain after the country refused to accept new NATO spending targets .  General Mills (GIS) projected lower annual profits on Wednesday, causing the stock to fall over 1% . The consumer group was hurt by weak demand for its refrigerated baked goods and snacks in the US, amid a tough economic environment affected by tariffs and uncertainty .

Analysts have zeroed in on Amazon’s Prime membership as a potential catalyst for “billions” of dollars in new revenue . Amazon may be on the verge of unlocking billions of dollars through a strategic move that it has pulled off successfully in the past .  Amazon is the global e-commerce and cloud leader known for its vast online marketplace, cloud computing division (AWS), digital advertising, and subscription services like Prime . Amazon’s subscription services segment (led by Prime) earned about $44.4 billion in 2024 .  Amazon posted another strong quarter this year, with Q1 results that topped expectations . Net sales rose 9% year-over-year to $155.7 billion, just above guidance . North America led the charge with $92.9 billion in sales, up 8%, while international sales grew 5% to $33.5 billion . AWS posted $29.3 billion in revenue, up 17% from a year ago .  Advertising was another bright spot, climbing around 18% to nearly $13.9 billion . Operating income hit $18.4 billion overall, up 20% year-over-year . Net income surged to $17.1 billion, or $1.59 per share, well above last year’s $0.98 .  Wall Street analysts remain broadly bullish on Amazon, even as they weigh near‑term headwinds like macroeconomic uncertainty and a moderation in AWS growth . Among 54 analysts tracked by Barchart, the consensus rating is a “Strong Buy” with an average price target of $244.32 .

Citi placed Trade Desk (NASDAQ:TTD) on a 90-day positive catalyst watch, citing signs of stronger ad spending and robust connected TV trends . The brokerage said it came away “incrementally more positive” on the outlook after meetings at Cannes Lions advertising conference .  Citi values the stock based on a blend of discounted cash flow, EV/revenue and EV/EBITDA multiples . The company’s strong topline growth, consistent take rates, and margin profile . in Q2 could drive a re-rating back above 30 times .

Google’s quiet AI win spells trouble for Amazon . The search giant has been quietly developing a next-gen arsenal of AI tools . Google has been a software-first company since the outset .  Google’s TPUs are tailor-made silicon that can effectively handle the monster math that runs modern AI models . These application-specific integrated circuits (ASICs) are specifically designed so neural networks can hum along at full throttle . TPU v4 took things up a notch, squeezing 1.2 to 1.7 times more performance per watt than Nvidia's A100 .  Nvidia still dominates the 70% to 95% share of the AI accelerator market, but TPUs are carving out a niche for high-volume inference jobs . Google still makes the lion’s share of its income (roughly 80%) from ads, powering search, YouTube, and partner sites .  OpenAI has predominantly tapped Nvidia’s powerful GPUs to train and run ChatGPT and its other large language models . With supply bottlenecks and cost constraints, OpenAI is looking to diversify its suppliers and meet the growing demands of its customers . If this deal holds, Open AI would be running its workloads on Google Cloud, Azure, Oracle, and CoreWeave .  Inferentia (inference chips) promised major cost savings but barely powers 3% of Amazon Web Services (AWS) AI work . Trainium (training workloads) undercuts Nvidia’s prices but keeps tripping over networking bugs and clunky software .

The July 4 holiday period is one of the most dangerous times of the year on U.S. roadways . Data shows 38% of fatalities during Independence Day weekend involve an alcohol-impaired driver . To help prevent crashes and save lives, NSC urges everyone to plan ahead .  The National Safety Council is America's leading nonprofit safety advocate . Plan ahead and designate a sober driver before celebrations begin . Use a rideshare service, taxi or public transportation if you've been drinking . Wear your seat belt — it's one of the simplest ways to save your life .  Keep people safer at work, but also beyond the workplace so they can live their fullest lives . When asked about specific unsolved problems more valuable than those AWS addressed, Mabrey responded with a single word: “Ontology” In AI terminology, ontology refers to structured frameworks that help machines interpret and reason about data, mirroring human understanding .  Palantir’s stock has surged 426% over the past year, closing Tuesday at $136.32 . Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez married in Venice, Italy . Guests included Oprah Winfrey, Leonardo DiCaprio, Bill Gates, Barbara Streisand and Orlando Bloom .  Events were hosted across iconic Venetian landmarks . The couple reportedly sourced nearly everything from local vendors . Bezos and Sánchez made charitable donations to local causes . The former Mrs. Bezos finalized her divorce in 2019 .  As of early 2024, Scott had donated more than $16.5 billion . By the end of that year, the total had grown to nearly $19.3 billion . Unlike many high-net-worth philanthropists, Scott has embraced a no-strings-attached approach .  While her ex was toasting with Hollywood royalty in Venice, Scott was quietly continuing her mission to give away every last dollar of her fortune . She's also addressed her privilege head-on, writing that she holds a "disproportionate amount of money," and has no intention of hoarding it .  Away Her Billions 'Until the Safe Is Empty' is a popular song written by Oprah Winfrey . Winfrey wrote the book, "Until the safe is empty" Winfrey is the author of a book called "The Power of the World"

Nothing launches its latest flagship phone after a two-year gap . The Phone (3) has a strange camera arrangement that forgoes the typical square or circular alignment found on other devices . The GV-backed startup aims to take on bigwigs like Samsung and Apple .  Nothing Phone (3a) Pro includes a 16-bit LED screen called Glyph Matrix on the back of the device at the top right . The company is also releasing mini-apps for this interface, such as spin the bottle and rock, paper, scissors . At launch this includes two features called Essential Space and Essential Search .  ChatGPT allows you to search for settings, files, or photos on your phone by typing in keywords . The new smartphone has comparable specifications to other companies’ Android flagships . The device is powered by a Snapdragon 8 Gen 4 processor, built on a 4-nanometer architecture .  Phone (3) has a 5,150 mAh battery (5,500 mAh in its India variant) with support for 65W wired charging and 15W wireless charging . Nothing is upgrading the selfie camera from 32 megapixel to 50 megapixels . Preorders for the device begin on July 4 with general availability on July 15 . The 256GB model will sell for $799 and the 512GB model for $899 .  Its other budget devices were available only through a restrictive beta program . It's not the first time the company has made its devices available widely available .

The tech behemoth now has 1 million robots in its warehouses . 75% of Amazon’s global deliveries are now assisted in some way by a robot . The company also announced a new generative AI model called DeepFleet .  Amazon’s one millionth robot was trained on its own warehouse and inventory data . The company has improved its fleet of robots in recent years, adding new capabilities and models . In May, Amazon unveiled its latest robot, Vulcan, which has two arms and a camera to grab items .

Andrew Behar is CEO of As You Sow, a nonprofit promoting environmental and social corporate responsibility . Behar: DEI is everywhere these days. Deere, Boeing, Visa, McDonalds, Amazon, Netflix, Walmart, Walmart and Amazon all have DEI programs .  Proposals from one anti-DEI filer asked companies to “terminate all DEI policies and programs that grant or deny employment or advancement opportunities based on race, sex, or other protected characteristics” Apple CEO Tim Cook reminded shareholders that innovation thrives on diverse perspectives .  Anti-DEI proposals “landed with a notable thud” as shareholders stood firm with management with an average 98% votes against ending diversity programs . Diverse voices and stories are not a political statement—they are core to the magic that captivates global audiences .  Shareholders have been in breach of their fiduciary duty if they supported proposals to end DEI . For these financial reasons, high-profile business leaders have publicly supported diversity programs . Executives and the board have the strongest possible mandate to cement DEI as a corporate imperative .  Companies that followed legal advice not to capitulateto DEI attacks sawhigher reputation scoresin 2025 . DeI initiatives aim to remove unseen barriers and unconscious bias, ensuring meritocracy functions as intended .  The 2025 proxy season affirmed diversity as an essential business principle grounded in business data . The dramatic confrontations that played out at over 20 companies solidified DEI’s place in the corporate world .

Analysts point to rising delivery and content costs as key drivers behind an expected jump from the current $139 annual rate . A $20 U.S. price bump, to $159, could generate about $3 billion more each year . Historically, Amazon has lifted Prime fees roughly every four years: to $99 in 2014, $119 in 2018 and $139 in 2022 .  If Amazon follows its usual cadence and implements a fee hike in 2026, the boost could further strengthen its services segment . Amazon already posted $44.4 billion in revenue last fiscal year in the face of heightened competition and costs .

Cloud infrastructure and IT solutions provider Oracle (ORCL) has been one of the top performers in the technology sector over the past few months . Oracle delivered robust fourth-quarter results, marked by double-digit revenue growth . Management remains upbeat and expects the revenue growth rate to accelerate in fiscal 2026 .  Oracle’s focus on cloud applications positions it as a leader in enterprise solutions . Cloud infrastructure services, in particular, saw exceptional demand, with contracted noncancelable bookings suggesting a projected revenue growth of over 70% in FY26 for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)  Oracle anticipates its total cloud revenue (spanning both applications and infrastructure) will accelerate from 24% growth in fiscal 2025 to over 40% in 2026 . CEO Safra Catz highlighted in a recent filing that Oracle is off to a strong start in FY26 . The company’s MultiCloud database business is growing at over 100% .  Revenue from MultiCloud database services delivered via these platforms surged 115% from Q3 to Q4 . Oracle currently operates 23 multi-cloud data centers, with another 47 under construction over the next 12 months . MultiCloud offering enables customers to integrate Oracle’s cloud products with services from major competitors .  Wall Street’s highest price target of $250 points to even more potential gains . Oracle operates 29 dedicated Cloud@Customer datacenters, with plans to add 30 more in FY26 . Consumption revenue from OCI grew 62% in the most recent quarter, with expectations of even faster growth ahead .

Rigetti focuses on gate-based quantum systems, emphasizing modular superconducting qubit architectures for universal quantum computing . D-Wave pioneers quantum annealing, a near-term, optimization-first approach that is already being used in real-world applications . Both companies are advancing quantum adoption through innovation, strategic partnerships, and platform accessibility .  Rigetti is building universal, gate-based quantum computers using superconducting qubits . Rigetti aims to launch a 108-qubit system by late 2025 . D-Wave’s quantum annealing systems are specialized for solving complex optimization problems .  Rigetti operates as a niche hardware innovator, focusing on the development of universal gate-based quantum processors . Revenue is primarily generated through its Quantum Cloud Services (QCS) platform . Rigetti also partners with government labs, universities, and select enterprises .  D-Wave, in contrast, positions itself as a solution-oriented service provider . Its business model is long-term by nature, dependent on scientific breakthroughs and hardware scaling milestones rather than immediate commercial wins . The company targets large-scale industries, including logistics, automotive, aerospace, and finance .  Rigetti’s growth hinges on advancing hardware scalability, doubling qubit counts, and improving fidelity through AI-assisted system calibration and fabrication improvements . D-Wave is expanding its customer base and hybrid capabilities while building toward a universal gate-based system .  The Zacks Consensus Estimate for RGTI’s 2025 sales implies a year-over-year decline of 18.63% For 2025, the loss per share is projected to be 5 cents compared with 36 cents a year ago . Rigetti currently holds a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell), signaling weaker near-term sentiment despite a solid Growth Score of ‘B’ that reflects its technical roadmap and potential upside .  Rigetti remains a promising deep-tech innovator targeting long-term breakthroughs . D-Wave’s enterprise traction, revenue visibility, and hybrid quantum roadmap position it as the more favorable pick for investors seeking exposure to quantum computing with nearer-term commercial potential .

Vasi Philomin, vice president of generative AI at Amazon Web Services, has departed the company . Philomin led the development of Amazon Bedrock, the company's platform for building and scaling foundation model-based applications . Rajesh Sheth, a vice president who previously led Amazon Elastic Block Store, has taken over some of Philomin's responsibilities .  Meta recently committed $14.3 billion to Scale AI and appointed its CEO, Alexandr Wang, to lead the project . As the AI arms race accelerates, companies are moving aggressively to secure experienced leadership in generative technologies .  This article first appeared on GuruFocus.com . SOUN is benefiting from restaurant operators shifting toward AI solutions from legacy answering systems . As of March 31, 2025 majority of SynqThree's locations have been upgraded to SOUN’s Polaris model, a multilingual automatic speech recognition .  Amazon’s Alexa Auto leverages its consumer ecosystem to deliver in-car voice functionality . SOUN is not much away from competition in this context . Shares of this California-based voice AI company have trended upward 23.9% in the past three months . Alphabet's stock looks undervalued when compared to other "Magnificent Seven" companies . Some investors may be concerned about the impact of AI tools and social media on Google Search usage . Yet, the search business remains strong and Google Cloud is positioned to be a key growth area .  Alphabet's forward price-to-earnings ratio (P/E) tells you how much you're paying per $1 of a company's projected earnings over the next 12 months . The higher the P/E ratio, the more expensive a stock is . Alphabet's average ratio over the past decade is around 29.7 . Over the past five years, it's been around 25.5 .  Google Search was 56% of Alphabet's $90.2 billion in revenue in the first quarter . Alphabet has tried to address this issue by integrating its own AI tools into Google Search . Investors may be skeptical about whether Google Search can maintain its dominance .  Google Search is Google's bread and butter, but other segments, such as YouTube, Google Cloud, and Waymo, have been growing impressively . In the first quarter, it made $12.3 billion in revenue, up 28% year over year . At its current trading price, Alphabet stock is too cheap to ignore .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is 1,069% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to177% for the S&P 500 . Don’t miss out on the latest top 10 list, available when you joinStock Advisor . Industrial software company announces general availability of HighByte Intelligence Hub version 4.2, enabling Agentic and AI-assisted DataOps at the edge . With the Intelligence Hub, AI agents can securely access all connected industrial systems and make real time or historical data requests .  Industrial AI has been a key challenge in utilizing Industrial AI technology has been its ability to understand the complexity of industrial environments . While industrial data is abundant and valuable, its fragmented nature has made seamless integration with AI models difficult . "HighByte Intelligence Hub solves this challenge," said John Harrington, Chief Product Officer at HighByte .  The latest release also introduces Git integration and OpenTelemetry (OTel) support to scale and manage deployments using DevOps tooling . Users will also have access to new Databricks and TimescaleDB connectors and enhanced connectivity with Apache Kafka and Amazon S3 .  HighByte Intelligence Hub version 4.2 is available now . All new features and capabilities introduced in the new version are included instandard pricing . The company’s proven Industrial DataOps software provides modeled, ready-to-use data to the Cloud .  Torey Penrod-Cambra is the Chief Communications Officer of Highbyte . She is also a senior executive of the company . Highbyte.com has a history of high-tech startups .

The tech giant said on Tuesday it now has more than 1m robots globally . This figure is approaching the total number of staff Amazon employs across its shipping warehouses .  Amazon shipped 3,870 packages per employee last year, compared to 175 in 2015 . The number of Amazon employees per facility has fallen to its lowest level in 16 years . The company says it has retrained 700,000 workers since 2019 .  Amazon has expanded into sub-same-day fulfilment centres and delivery stations . Spokesman said: ‘These shifts, supported by new automation and AI systems, help us get closer to customers and improve the experience for both employees and shoppers .

Michael Saylor’s Strategy is likely to register an unrealized gain of about $14 billion in the second quarter . Strategy is forecast to post only about $112.8 million in second-quarter revenue from the software business . The former MicroStrategy Inc. can attribute the eye-popping results to a rebound in the price of Bitcoin .  Strategy’s shares have soared over 3,300% since Saylor began buying Bitcoin in the middle of 2020 . The likely record profit for the three months ended June 30 follows a barrage of criticism from naysayers such as Jim Chanos .  Strategy posted a record $4.2 billion loss the first quarter, which saw Bitcoin slump 12% . Bitcoin is up around 1,000% during the same period, while the S&P 500 has increased around 115% . Strategy now recognizes the unrealized changes that often produce big swings in earnings .  Strategy is expected to release second-quarter results in August . The 30% appreciation in Bitcoin increased the market value of those holdings by over $13 billion . Strategy co-founder and Chairman Saylor has become a phenomenon on both Wall Street and in the crypto industry .  Saylor’s Bitcoin accumulation tactic has inspired dozens of copycats looking to emulate his success . Funding of the buying binge has evolved into an elaborate combination of common stock and debt sales . Hedge funds have been driving demand for the convertible debt, as they seek out the company for trades .  BitMine Immersion Technologies Inc. announced a $250 million private placement to fund an Ether treasury on Monday . Upexi Inc. recently raised $100 million to buy the Solana token . “It remains to be seen whether these companies would be successful or not,” Palmer said .

The AI market is growing, and as the dominant chip company, Nvidia is leading the way . Companies with heavy exposure to AI have been some of the market's best performers in recent years . Two Motley Fool contributors think two companies with leading positions in AI will stand as the world's most valuable businesses five years from now .  Nvidia has a massive opportunity over the next few years as AI gets incorporated more into what people do . Revenue increased 69% year over year in its fiscal 2026 first quarter . Nvidia has incredibly high gross margins, which came in at 71.3% in the first quarter without a one-time charge .  Nvidia's data center revenue increased 73% year over year in the first quarter . Data center revenue set the pace for the company overall . The AI market is expected to increase at a compound annual growth rate of 26% over the next five years .  Nvidia is launching Blackwell Ultra, a more powerful tool for AI reasoning, which is the next step after inference and requires greater capacity . CEO Jensen Huang envisions a future not too far off where AI is used in everything we do .  AI could make Amazon the world's most valuable company within the next half-decade . The company's e-commerce business still accounts for the majority of its revenue . E-commerce has historically been a relatively low-margin business .  Amazon has a clear path to being one of the world's most valuable companies . The e-commerce side of the business will quickly command a much higher valuation premium . There's a significant amount of guesswork involved in charting how quickly this transformation will take shape .  The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years . Nike is still reporting declines, but it's making progress on its turnaround strategy . The company just reported a strong earnings beat, and it's the leader, by far, in its industry . Wall Street analyst sees Nike stock shooting 60% higher over the next 12 to 18 months .  Sales were down 12% from last year in the quarter, with Nike Direct sales down 14% . CEO Elliot Hill restructured innovation to focus on lines rather than categories . It also widened its wholesale channels to reach more customers in more places .  Nike's lead against its competition is so wide that it really has no competition, at least for first place . Some of its competitors have been posting much better performance despite operating in the same environment . Investors shouldn't ignore the risks .  Nike has been in first place for favorite shoe brand for years . However, Nike's share fell from recent averages of around 60% to only 49%. Converse, which has recently featured in the No. 2 spot, wasn't in the top three .  Nike is a blue chip stock that should bounce back and offer resilience over time . at the current price, which makes it attractive for passive income investors even while the company is still struggling . If you have a long timeline, you could buy Nike stock today and enjoy the dividend while the stock gets back to work .  Nike stock could Soar 60% according to 1 Wall Street analyst . Technology stocks are perennially one of the hottest areas of the stock market . Investors closely follow this sector because of its track record of scorching returns . So it can be worth keeping an eye on tech stocks and tracking the hot performers .  Investors should also keep an eye on some of tech’s laggards, too . Sometimes the reason a stock might be underperforming is because it skyrocketed the year before . Sometimes investors need time to digest the good news and the underlying business needs time to catch up to the stock price . This year's underperforming stock could well become a darling again next year .  Any investor can take part in the rising tech industry, even with just a little knowledge . Investors have the ability to buy index funds based on whatever sector of the market they want .  Tracking the hottest tech stocks is a good way to find out what the market likes . But if you want to go out and invest in some of these names, it’s important that you research the business and understand what you’re actually buying .  past investment product performance is no guarantee of future price appreciation . past investment products performance has been the subject of past investments in the U.S. past investments . past investments have been the focus of the past few years .

Half of Temu’s monthly US users left the marketplace between March and June . Shein and Temu quickly became top US retailers by hawking ultra-cheap, heavily marketed products . In May, POTUS Trump scrapped the “de minimis” exemption that had allowed them to ship packages .  Temu stopped shipping goods from China to the US in March, only displaying products from its US warehouses on its US site . Shein is reportedly expanding its production in India, with plans to start shipping India-made clothes in the US within a year .  Any price hikes and supply-chain slowdowns resulting from the demise of de minimis could prompt shoppers to return to rivals like Amazon . Zara-parent Inditex and H&M both reportedweaker second quarters than analysts expected .

New data from hedge fund giant Coatue Management reveals a striking shift in the technology landscape that could reshape portfolios . Coatue’s analysis shows cracks forming in the “Magnificent 7” tech stocks .  In 2025 year-to-date, four of the seven titans are in negative territory . This marks a dramatic reversal from their collective 1,448% Nvidia surge and triple-digit gains across the board over the past five years . Coatue’s research on market leadership turnover is the lowest since 1995 .  Coatue’s “Fantastic 40” projection for 2030 offers a roadmap for where institutional money might be heading . The hedge fund, known for early bets on companies like Uber and TikTok parent ByteDance, sees massive shifts coming: The New Giants (Projected 2030 Market Caps): Microsoft maintaining the No. 1 spot at $5.7 trillion Nvidia holding strong at No. 2 . SpaceX projected at $871 billion (No. 12)  AI-related market scares are becoming more frequent and severe . Investors need to prepare for continued volatility as the market figures out which companies can monetize artificial intelligence . Consider spreading exposure across Coatue’s broader “Fantastic 40” list .  Coatue’s data suggests these selloffs, while painful, create buying opportunities for long-term investors . The tech landscape is shifting from a handful of dominant players to a more diverse ecosystem . For investors, this creates both risk and opportunity .  onBenzinga.com: Are you a big winner? Share your thoughts with us at CNN.com/news@CNN.com .

Amazon CEO Andy Jassy sees the rise of AI as a watershed moment . Apple is taking a conservative approach to AI capital expenditures by leveraging partnerships . Amazon is willing to spend substantial sums on AI, with over $24 billion spent in the first quarter alone .  Apple seemed to take an early lead in AI with the arrival of Siri on the iPhone in 2011 . Since then, the company has chosen to partner rather than invest in the costly infrastructure needed for AI systems .  Industry forecasts estimate the AI market will expand from $244 billion in 2025 to $1 trillion by 2031 . There's time for Apple to capitalize on the sector's growth, so the company's slow AI progress isn't a death knell .  Amazon uses AI to manage a fleet of more than 750,000 robot workers in its warehouses . Amazon's AI capabilities help it smartly adjust prices across its vast universe of products . This helped Amazon grow Q1 sales by 9% year over year to $155.7 billion .  Amazon sees AI as a game changer, and Andy Jassy said: "That's why there are more than 1,000 GenAI applications being built across Amazon." Apple has the potential not only to catch up, but also to deliver groundbreaking products . Amazon's P/E multiple was substantially higher a year ago, but has since dropped .  The Motley Fool Stock Advisoranalyst team just identified what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy now… and Amazon wasn’t one of them . The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years .  The Motley Fool has members of its board of directors . Apple is one of the 10 most profitable companies in the U.S. stock market .
